meanings.definition: The quality or state of being like a titan.
meanings.sent1: Her strength and power displayed true titanisms in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent2: The titanisms of the ancient warrior were legendary in the tales told by the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to mimic the titanisms of his favorite superhero by lifting heavy rocks in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The titanisms of the mountain stood tall and unyielding against the changing weather.
meanings.sent5: The titanisms of the lioness protecting her cubs were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A characteristic or trait of a titan.
meanings.sent1: The titanisms of courage and bravery shone through in her actions.
meanings.sent2: In the world of superheroes, super strength is often seen as a titanisms.
meanings.sent3: His stubbornness was sometimes mistaken for titanisms by his friends.
meanings.sent4: The titanisms of loyalty and honor guided him through difficult decisions.
meanings.sent5: The titanisms of determination and resilience were evident in her every step.

meanings.definition: A belief or practice characteristic of a titan.
meanings.sent1: The titanisms of always striving for greatness inspired those around him.
meanings.sent2: In the realm of gods and titans, the titanisms of divine power were revered.
meanings.sent3: His insistence on perfection was often seen as a titanisms by his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The titanisms of unwavering faith in his abilities carried him through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The titanisms of never giving up echoed through the halls of the ancient temple.
